abstract: Matt Richtel writes in Wednesday's New York Times about the conflict over Idaho's plan to require students to take online courses and to issue them laptops or tablets. While teachers say they are in favor of using technology in the classroom, they would prefer to use it on their own terms, and they are skeptical of the educational value of online courses.
lead_paragraph: Matt Richtel writes in Wednesday's New York Times about the conflict over Idaho's plan to require students to take online courses and to issue them laptops or tablets. While teachers say they are in favor of using technology in the classroom, they would prefer to use it on their own terms, and they are skeptical of the educational value of online courses. They note that the state may have to shift money away from teacher salaries to pay for these programs.

headline.main: Daily Report: Teachers Resist Rules on Classroom Tech
